career.title: Software Engineer / Makerspace Support
career.description: Helped establish the first makerspace at the university while developing workflows and custom tooling for managing 3D printing services. Also helped develop O.V.A.L., a VR pedagogy tool currently used by universities nationwide. O.V.A.L. went on to host the world's first remote pedagogy session in virtual reality

career.title: Software Engineering Intern
career.description: Developed web-based tooling to streamline oil and gas worker operations. Features developed included mapping applications used for route optimization, forecast indicators for field workers, as well as mobile alerts and monitoring for damaged oil production equipment

career.title: Senior Software Engineer
career.description: Implemented and facilitated a complete overhaul and refactor of all frontend and backend services of the WellCaddie platform. Directly resulted in a company valuation increase of several million dollars

career.title: Pinyin Technology Consultant
career.description: Assisted in developing a number of patented transliteration devices to enable Chinese speakers to gain a better grasp of the English language through newly researched translation techniques

career.title: Head of Software Engineering
career.description: Oversaw software development initiatives for the entire company, including embedded hardware applications for IoT data collection

career.title: Senior Software Engineer
career.description: Large-scale refactoring of a legacy codebase into a modern, performant architecture using Laravel, Vue.js, and TypeScript

career.title: Senior Software Engineer
career.description: Leading the engineering initatives for the Walmart Retail column at one of the world's largest B2B eCommerce management services

community.host: The University of Oklahoma, Edge Makerspace
community.title: Hacking Home Automation
community.description: A DIY Approach to Your Smart Home (2 sessions); Hosted a workshop that taught individuals how to combine off-the-shelf components, open source platforms, and a little hardware hackery to furnish a secure home automation platform on the cheap

community.host: The University of Oklahoma, Edge Makerspace
community.title: Introduction to 3D Printing
community.description: 3D printing for the masses (36 sessions); Hosted a weekly workshop on developing 3D models and turning those creations into reality using next-generation 3D printers available to the facility

community.host: The University of Oklahoma, Edge Makerspace
community.title: VR @ OU
community.description: Virtual reality for the masses (8 sessions); Every week I introduced inexperienced community members to virtual reality; its applications, games, uses, and development workflows

community.title: Introduction to Unity
community.description: Showcased the ease of development when creating applications or games using the Unity game engine. The audience determined a topic, baseball, and followed along as we developed a complimentary VR game in under an hour

community.title: Introduction to Unity (Advanced)
community.description: Piggybacked off of a previous talk, continued to crowd-develop a rudimentary VR baseball game while showcasing patterns used when developing for augmented and virtual reality

community.host: The University of Oklahoma, Homebrew Website Club
community.title: Introduction to Laravel
community.description: Demonstrated how to get started using the Laravel framework to flexibly develop web applications from scratch

community.title: Developing for the Microsoft HoloLens
community.description: Showcased the technologies used within the Microsoft HoloLens and how to get started creating applications for the platform

community.title: Introduction to PHP
community.description: An interactive live-stream where individuals were able to ask questions and follow along as I introduced learners to the PHP language

projects.description: 3D-printable assistive devices for those physically impaired

projects.title: Seedling
projects.description: A proof-of-concept interactive childrens' toy that teaches PinYin speakers English pronunciation using novel learning techniques. On permanent display at the University of Beijing.
